contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Former Subdivision |conventional_long_name = County of Närke and Värmland |native_name = ''Närke och Värmlands län'' |common_name = Närke and Värmland |subdivision = County |nation = [[Kingdom of Sweden (1721–1809)|Sweden]] |year_start = 1634 |event_start = |date_start = |event_end = |year_end = 1779 |date_end = |event1 = |date_event1 = |p1 = |flag_p1 = |s1 = County of Örebro |flag_s1 = Naval Ensign of Sweden.svg |s2 = County of Värmland |flag_s2 = Naval Ensign of Sweden.svg |image_flag = Naval Ensign of Sweden.svg |image_coat = |image_map = |image_map_caption = |capital = Örebro |leader1 = |year_leader1 = |leader2 = |year_leader2 = |title_leader = Governor |footnotes = }} [[File:Närkevärmlandslän 1779.png|thumb|Närke and Värmland County 1654-1779 (blue). Marked in red is [[Tiveden]], which later was added to Örebro County.]] '''Närke and Värmland County''' ({{Lang-sv|Närkes och Värmlands län}}) was the earlier name of [[Örebro County]] in [[Sweden]], between 1634 and 1779. In that year [[Värmland]] ceded to form [[Värmland County]]. Since [[Närke]] only corresponded the southern part of the remaining territory and the name was changed to reflect the city where the [[County Governors of Sweden|Governor]] resided, namely [[Örebro]]. ==See also== * [[Counties of Sweden]] * [[Provinces of Sweden]] * [[List of Örebro Governors]] {{Coord missing|Sweden}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Narke And Varmland}} [[Category:Former counties of Sweden]] {{Sweden-geo-stub}}
